catch_line: ELECTRONIC TRAFFIC AND PEDESTRIAN CONTROL SIGNALS.

1.name: ARTICLE I. - PEDESTRIANS' RIGHTS AND DUTIES
1.label: article

full_text:
(a) Pedestrians crossing roadways at intersections where electronic traffic-control signals are located which are regulated by separate electronic pedestrian signals must obey the instructions of the pedestrian signals.(b) Pedestrians who are lawfully in a roadway when the pedestrian signal changes should proceed across the roadway.(c) Pedestrians crossing roadways at signalized intersections which are not regulated by separate electronic pedestrian signals must obey the instructions of the traffic-control signal facing vehicular traffic moving in the same direction as such pedestrians.(d) Pedestrians crossing roadways at signalized intersections which are not regulated by separate pedestrian signals must not start to cross when a yellow light is exhibited to vehicles.(e) The electronic traffic and pedestrian control signals described in this section shall be located, and the regulations provided in this section shall be effective, as designed in official Traffic Schedule No. 1, “Electronic Traffic Control Signals.” 
Cross reference: Electronic traffic-control signals, §11-2071
